basics.name: Alyssia Chen
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.A. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences; a B.B.A in Marketing at the Shidler College of Business at the University of Hawaii; and a B.A. minor at the Department of Psychology. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2023.

courses: ICS 111 - Introduction to Computer Science I
ICS 211 - Introduction to Computer Science II
ICS 485 - Video Game Design and Development
BUS 310 - Statistical Analysis for Business Decisions
BUS 311 - Information Systems for Global Business Environments
BUS 313 - Economics & Finanical Environment of Global Business
ACC 200/210 - Introduction to Accounting I & II
COMG 251 - Principles of Efficient Public Speaking
ICS 101 - Tools for the Information World
ITM 387K - Advanced Topics in Information System: Business Intelligence

highlights: Created 2 marketing campaigns that I presented to the CEO, CFO, and CTO
Programmed a new view in the web application using Java Spring Boot and React
Use C# to build a tool that can create xml files that adheres to federal and state-given schemas
Assist with service requests for the Gentax application
Utilize content management system WordPress, the email delivery vendor Mailchimp, and the Hawaii State Calendar of Events
Gained hands-on experience (statistical analysis, data visualization) with R
Created and developed research questions related to health analytics based on a national dataset
Learned how to conduct reproducible, replicable, and ethical research

work.summary: Help principal investigators with their research
highlights: Managed a database of parents to contact for the studies once their children are eligible
Improved efficiency of a database by creating codes and automating processes
Read and assessed pertinent research articles related to child development and social psychology at weekly lab meetings
Wrote basic code to analyze the effectiveness of educational philosophy in R

awards.title: 7th place in Purdue Univ. Northwest’s College of Business International Digital Marketing Competition
awards.awarder: Purdue Univ. Northwest’s College of Business
awards.summary: Over the course of 3 months, our team created an exciting marketing campaign for this year's case about Radio Flyer E-bikes. Out of 242 teams, our team placed 7th. For more details: https://digitalmarketingcompetition.com/2023/04/spring-2023-digital-marketing-competition-finalists-announced/.

awards.title: UH Venture Competition Semifinalist
awards.summary: The UH Venture Competition (formerly UH Business Plan Competition) started in 2000 and has become one of the most exciting events for University of Hawai‘i students and faculty interested in starting a business. The competition is a semester-long program that provides hands-on education, mentorship, and resources to aspiring entrepreneurs. Competitors from various fields collaborate and practice developing a business plan and pitching it to investors.

awards.title: Double Finalist in Breakthrough Innovation Challenge
awards.summary: The UH Breakthrough Innovation Challenge is an entrepreneurial competition where participants pitch their innovative business idea to a panel of judges, for a chance to win cash prizes.

awards.title: Meteor International Hackathon 2nd Place
awards.summary: Over the course of a week, our team of 5 built gamified application to track people's sustainable habits while utilizing theories of social norm and social comparison. Out of 94 registered teams, our team placed 2nd.

awards.title: Dean's list
awards.summary: Special recognition awarded to students with a minimum GPA of 3.5.

awards.title: Provost’s Achievement Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to high-achieving Hawaiʻi high school graduates.
